intro: Axinaea radula, commonly known as the red-stemmed axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Axinaea radula is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests.
